result.execSummary:
The defendant Valente M Campbell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if one has not already been given, pay DNA surcharge.  Pay all other court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.

First six months are to be served straight time.  
As to the remaining six months: court allows release privileges  for employment and Day Reporting Center purposes only.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valente M Campbell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Valente M Campbell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Valente M Campbell in custody.  Sarah McNutt for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 12 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION as follows:  First 6 months are to be served "straight time".  As to the remaining 6 months, Court allows release privileges for employment and Day Reporting Center purposes only.  Credit for 83 days time served.
.
COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to pay the balance of all other court costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Valente M Campbell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Valente M Campbell in custody.  Sarah McNutt for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILTIY FOR PURPOSES OF THE SPEEDY JURY TRIAL IN BRANCH 2.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court ordered the bail to remain the same. If the Defendant can post bail Court ordered Defendant turned over to JusticePoint for supervision.

Defendant Valente M Campbell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Valente M Campbell in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are prepared to proceed with the Speedy Jury Trial set for 06-11-2014 at 08:30 am. Defense would like to be heard as to bail.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Valente M Campbell not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Bail is currently set at $5,000.00 cash.
Defense moves for a bail modification to $1,500.00 cash.
State objects.
Arguments heard.
Court DENIED defense's motion and ordered bail to remain set at $5,000.00 cash.
Case adjourned to the already scheduled Final Pretrial Conference date on 05-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT/  MOTION FOR BAIL MODIFICATION  (15 pages) commencing APRIL 9, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Valente M Campbell not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Defense makes a speedy trial demand.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-21-2014 at 8:30 AM for Final Pretrial Conference AND 06-11-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Valente M Campbell in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Valente M Campbell in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Braunreiter-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Valente M Campbell not in court, in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke is assigned to this case, but was not present for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is refusing to come to court for today's proceedings.  Defense Counsel is requesting an adjournment to speak with the defendant in the jail.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Valente M Campbell in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Valente M Campbell in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Valente M Campbell
Current: 3845 N 27th St, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-26-2014)
Prior: 437 North 31st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
